001package imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.chew;
002

011
012import java.util.Collections;
013import java.util.HashMap;
014import java.util.Map;
015import java.util.Set;
016
017/**
018 * Straightforward undirected graph implementation.
019 * Nodes are generic type N.
020 *
021 * @author Paul Chew
022 *
023 * Created November, December 2007.  For use in Delaunay/Voronoi code.
024 *
025 */
026public class Graph<N> {
027
028    private Map<N, Set<N>> theNeighbors =    // Node -> adjacent nodes
029        new HashMap<N, Set<N>>();
030    private Set<N> theNodeSet =              // Set view of all nodes
031        Collections.unmodifiableSet(theNeighbors.keySet());
032
033    /**
034     * Add a node.  If node is already in graph then no change.
035     * @param node the node to add
036     */
037    public void add (N node) {
038        if (theNeighbors.containsKey(node)) return;
039        theNeighbors.put(node, new ArraySet<N>());
040     }
041
042    /**
043     * Add a link. If the link is already in graph then no change.
044     * @param nodeA one end of the link
045     * @param nodeB the other end of the link
046     * @throws NullPointerException if either endpoint is not in graph
047     */
048    public void add (N nodeA, N nodeB) throws NullPointerException {
049        theNeighbors.get(nodeA).add(nodeB);
050        theNeighbors.get(nodeB).add(nodeA);
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * Remove node and any links that use node. If node not in graph, nothing
055     * happens.
056     * @param node the node to remove.
057     */
058    public void remove (N node) {
059        if (!theNeighbors.containsKey(node)) return;
060        for (N neighbor: theNeighbors.get(node))
061            theNeighbors.get(neighbor).remove(node);    // Remove "to" links
062        theNeighbors.get(node).clear();                 // Remove "from" links
063        theNeighbors.remove(node);                      // Remove the node
064    }
065
066    /**
067     * Remove the specified link. If link not in graph, nothing happens.
068     * @param nodeA one end of the link
069     * @param nodeB the other end of the link
070     * @throws NullPointerException if either endpoint is not in graph
071     */
072    public void remove (N nodeA, N nodeB) throws NullPointerException {
073        theNeighbors.get(nodeA).remove(nodeB);
074        theNeighbors.get(nodeB).remove(nodeA);
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Report all the neighbors of node.
079     * @param node the node
080     * @return the neighbors of node
081     * @throws NullPointerException if node does not appear in graph
082     */
083    public Set<N> neighbors (N node) throws NullPointerException {
084        return Collections.unmodifiableSet(theNeighbors.get(node));
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * Returns an unmodifiable Set view of the nodes contained in this graph.
089     * The set is backed by the graph, so changes to the graph are reflected in
090     * the set.
091     * @return a Set view of the graph's node set
092     */
093    public Set<N> nodeSet () {
094        return theNodeSet;
095    }
096
097}
